properties.name: 1356 Grace Avenue, Hyde Park
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit1352 Grace Avenue, Cincinnati, Ohio 45208Renting a room from Joey. Many good times were had at this old house. I\'ll never forget it. Oh, yeah. This is where she jumped my bone(s).

properties.description: Posted by Seifrit2030 Union St, San Francisco, CAWe met your DZ sister here for dinner.

properties.name: Girlhood (and adulthood) home
properties.description: Posted by SeifritCamargo Woods Court, Cincinnati, OhioCamargo Woods Court: This is the location of the formation of her lovely foundation....very close to a gas station.

properties.name: Gramercy Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit42 E 20th St, New York, NYbeef cheeks

properties.name: Historic Buckeye Building
properties.description: Posted by SeifritOn the corner above Flannery\'s Pub lived Ashley Blair Martin from April 1999 to April of 2000. Just enough time for the place to go from charming to annoying.

properties.name: Hotel Cornell de France
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit 715 Bush St, San Francisco, CAThis hotel was in a great location, near Union Square, etc. But, it was rustic. The picture is from their website describing a "cozy queen" room. I think it might be our room.

properties.name: Hotel Del Coronado
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit 1500 Orange Ave, Coronado, CALiterally, "hotel of the coronado". A beautiful seaside hotel with a rich history of hosting the 20th century Hollywood elite. Impeccable grounds, world class staff, and deluxe accomodations set the "Del" apart from all the rest. Oh yeah, we stayed across the street at unremarkable Glorietta Bay Inn.

properties.name: Joia
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit140 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach, FL"Are you ready?"

properties.name: Keeneland
properties.description: Posted by SeifritIf there was anything that brought us together, it was our love of boozing and betting on the thoroughbreds.

properties.name: Knox Presbyterian Church
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit3400 Michigan Ave, Cincinnati, OHWhere we tied the knot

properties.name: Manele Bay
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit463 Main St, Honolulu, HIBeautiful remote place, too bad we could only afford two nights

properties.name: Montreal Quebec
properties.description: Posted by SeifritWe stayed at the Ritz Carlton, which was nice, but not like an American Ritz.

properties.name: Our Birthplace - Christ Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit 2139 Auburn Ave. Cincinnati, Ohio 45219OK, there were 2,637 days between my birth and hers, but it\'s still the same location. Coincidence???

properties.name: Place Name
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit7600 Trails End 44023

properties.name: Rose Pistola
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit532 Columbus Avenue, San Francisco, CA, 94133Just so we never forget the name. This place was in the Italian district.

properties.name: Shangri-la Hotel Santa Monica
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit 1301 Ocean Ave, Santa Monica, CAShangri-La is a fictional place described in the 1933 novel Lost Horizon by British author James Hilton. Shangri-La is also a non-fictional two-star hotel in a perfect spot on Ocean Avenue in Santa Monica. With a staff of disinterested "future Americans", and a "Boogie Nights" decor, the Shagri-La offered us a chance to spend a lot of time out of our hotel room. But hey, that\'s what vacations are all about. The Shangri-La offered an olfactory medley of non-offensive but "funny" smells. Otherwise LA was fantastic. Can\'t wait to get back.

properties.name: Soho Metropolitan Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit Summertime trip to Toronto was OK. I think we liked it better in the winter. Sotto Sotto was the highlight of the trip.

properties.name: Tally Ho Inn
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit  6th Ave, Carmel, CAthe Tally Ho was a beautiful place, I wonder what we\'d think of it today. The staff at Il Fornaio restaurant brought our meal to us in the room. Great bathtub!

properties.name: The Orchid
properties.description: Posted by SeifritOur first stop in Hawaii. A lovely place.

properties.name: The Santa Barbara Jamba Juice
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit742 State St, Santa Barbara, CAOne thing we loved about California was Jamba Juice. There was one on the strip in Santa Barbara. We parked the Lumina and went inside.

properties.name: Wasington DC
properties.description: Posted by Seifrit1600 Pennsylvania Ave, Washington DCseifrit says: Probably the Spring of 2000. One of our last low budget trips. We flew Southwest to Baltimore and took a train to DC. All on foot/metro (or cab): Capitol building, mall, Lincoln Memorial, Smithsonian Modern Art Museum, DuPont Circle, Georgetown, Adams-Morgan, Filene\'s Basement

properties.name: Where we first met
properties.description: Posted by SeifritPNC Bank CincinnatiWe met here in March of 1996. I was a struggling performance artist trying to make ends meet with a low end bank job. She was a saucy young financier with a different business suit for every day of the week. Just my luck: I started work on a Wednesday...Wednesday was canary jacket with tight navy skirt. One couldn\'t help but notice.

properties.name: Wren Cottage
properties.description: Posted by Seifrittoo hot to print here
